snippet: After long delays, the former military dictator Gen. Efraín Ríos Montt, under whose rule tens of thousands of villagers were killed in a civil war against leftists, is set to stand trial.
abstract: Former Guatemalan dictator Gen Efrain Rios Montt, under whose rule tens of thousands of villagers were killed in civil war against leftists, is set to stand trial; proceedings will be one of few times that any credible national court is trying former leader on charges of genocide.
lead_paragraph: After long delays, the former military dictator Gen. Efraín Ríos Montt, under whose rule tens of thousands of villagers were killed in a civil war against leftists, is set to stand trial.

headline.seo: Victims of Guatemala Civil War Eagerly Await Dictator’s Trial
headline.main: In Effort to Try Dictator, Guatemala Shows New Judicial Might
headline.print_headline: In Effort to Try Dictator, Guatemala Shows New Judicial Might

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
